bug.author: HuichuanLiu
bug.description: My word2vec model was serialized in 0.7.0 deeplearning4j-nlp and could by loaded by public WordVectorsImpl loadExistingModel(String path) throws FileNotFoundException { File file = new File(path); return WordVectorSerializer.readWord2VecModel(file); } But it failed in 0.7.2 Then I rolled back 0.7.0, everything is fine.

comments.comment: Can i have some more details? What's the model, how it was created etc.
But i need that exception :)
I see. But due to the network, swap version is quite time-consuming here. Can't do it right now but will update this issue later, lets say someday within this week.
Sure, just remember - without actual exception i can't do anything.
Ofcourse:)

It is not about deeplearning4j-nlp, it's about the nd4j-native-platform. The all-well version is 0.7.0, can not deserialize after updated to 0.7.2. Workable dependency: <denchmark-code><groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId> <version>${nd4j.version}</version> </denchmark-code>
Problem dependency: <denchmark-code><groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId> <version>0.7.2</version> </denchmark-code>

FYI, the whole pom: <denchmark-code><?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd"> <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

<dependencyManagement> <dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId> <version>${nd4j.version}</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-cuda-7.5-platform</artifactId> <version>0.7.2</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-cuda-8.0-platform</artifactId> <version>${nd4j.version}</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>edu.stanford.nlp</groupId> <artifactId>stanford-corenlp</artifactId> <version>3.6.0</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>edu.stanford.nlp</groupId> <artifactId>stanford-corenlp</artifactId> <version>3.6.0</version> <classifier>models</classifier> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>edu.stanford.nlp</groupId> <artifactId>stanford-corenlp</artifactId> <version>3.6.0</version> <classifier>models-chinese</classifier> </dependency> </dependencies>

<dependencies> <!-- ND4J backend. You need one in every DL4J project. Normally define artifactId as either "nd4j-native-platform" or "nd4j-cuda-7.5-platform" --> <dependency> <groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId> </dependency>
<!-- Core DL4J functionality --> <dependency> <groupId>org.deeplearning4j</groupId> <artifactId>deeplearning4j-core</artifactId> <version>0.7.2</version> </dependency>
<dependency> <groupId>org.deeplearning4j</groupId> <artifactId>deeplearning4j-nlp</artifactId> <version>${dl4j.version}</version> </dependency>

<!-- Used in the feedforward/classification/MLP* and feedforward/regression/RegressionMathFunctions example --> <dependency> <groupId>jfree</groupId> <artifactId>jfreechart</artifactId> <version>${jfreechart.version}</version> </dependency> <dependency> <groupId>org.jfree</groupId> <artifactId>jcommon</artifactId> <version>${jcommon.version}</version> </dependency>

</dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>exec-maven-plugin</artifactId> <version>${exec-maven-plugin.version}</version> <executions> <execution> <goals> <goal>exec</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <executable>java</executable> </configuration> </plugin> <plugin> <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId> <artifactId>maven-shade-plugin</artifactId> <version>${maven-shade-plugin.version}</version> <configuration> <shadedArtifactAttached>true</shadedArtifactAttached> <shadedClassifierName>${shadedClassifier}</shadedClassifierName> <createDependencyReducedPom>true</createDependencyReducedPom> <filters> <filter> <artifact>*:*</artifact> <excludes> <exclude>org/datanucleus/**</exclude> <exclude>META-INF/*.SF</exclude> <exclude>META-INF/*.DSA</exclude> <exclude>META-INF/*.RSA</exclude> </excludes> </filter> </filters> </configuration> <executions> <execution> <phase>package</phase> <goals> <goal>shade</goal> </goals> <configuration> <transformers> <transformer implementation="org.apache.maven.plugins.shade.resource.AppendingTransformer"> <resource>reference.conf</resource> </transformer> <transformer implementation="org.apache.maven.plugins.shade.resource.ServicesResourceTransformer"/> <transformer implementation="org.apache.maven.plugins.shade.resource.ManifestResourceTransformer"> </transformer> </transformers> </configuration> </execution> </executions> </plugin>

</project> </denchmark-code>

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/HuichuanLiu>@HuichuanLiu</denchmark-link> Looks like there are conflicting libraries on your system. Try to set the "java.library.path" system property to the empty string "" before anything else and see what that gives.

<denchmark-code> public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
    {
        System.setProperty("java.library.path","");
        testLSTM();
    }
</denchmark-code>

Doesn't work.
In fact, I used the parent template pom from GravesLSTM example, which is based on 0.7.0 nd4js, but alter the nd4j-native-platform version to 0.7.2, probably the problem?

Then please try this: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/bytedeco/javacpp-presets/wiki/Debugging-UnsatisfiedLinkError-on-Windows>https://github.com/bytedeco/javacpp-presets/wiki/Debugging-UnsatisfiedLinkError-on-Windows</denchmark-link>
where "module" is "Nd4jCpu".

<denchmark-code>        System.setProperty("java.library.path","");

        try {
            Loader.load(Nd4jCpu.class);
        } catch (UnsatisfiedLinkError e) {
            String path = Loader.cacheResource(Nd4jCpu.class, "windows-x86_64/jni<module>.dll").getPath();
            new ProcessBuilder("C:\\Users\\lj-18\\Downloads\\depends22_x64\\depends.exe", path).start().waitFor();
        }

        testLSTM();
</denchmark-code>

nothing change

So the exception does not get thrown by Loader.load(Nd4jCpu.class) and that means everything is fine. It seems like you're trying to use some classes of an old version of ND4J alongside some classes from version 0.7.2. If that's what you are trying to do, that won't work.

Well, this program was implemented with nd4j-native-platform 0.7.0 and updated to 0.7.2 recently. So, yes, some out-of-date classes might be used and probably result in version conflicts. I've already rolled back to 0.7.0 and that fixs my problem, currently.
can you please show gist with your current source code which reproduces this issue with 0.7.2? I can't reproduce it myself at this moment.

Which part? In my case, a simple "Nd4j.create(1)" in main() could trigger that exception. Like mentioned above: <denchmark-code>public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception{ Nd4j.create(1) } </denchmark-code>
This will crack. And the pom file is also post above. <denchmark-link:https://gist.github.com/HuichuanLiu/6f12907d02bf7f7355a432ef229030b7>https://gist.github.com/HuichuanLiu/6f12907d02bf7f7355a432ef229030b7</denchmark-link>
nd4j.version is probably not 0.7.2.

Quite sure it is 0.7.2. The dependency in pom without this issue: <denchmark-code><groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId> <version>${nd4j.version}</version> </denchmark-code>
The dependency in pom when the exception occured: <denchmark-code><groupId>org.nd4j</groupId> <artifactId>nd4j-native-platform</artifactId> <version>0.7.2</version> </denchmark-code>
For more information: The value of {nd4j.version} was 0.7.0, which came from: <denchmark-code><parent> <groupId>org.deeplearning4j</groupId> <artifactId>deeplearning4j-examples-parent</artifactId> <version>0.7-SNAPSHOT</version> </parent> </denchmark-code>
